page.title: 13Keeping a toad in school
page.content: When we searched for minibeasts one of our girls found a little toad under a stone.Teacher let us keep "him" in the classroom providing we fed and cared for him. Into a fish tank we put:- 6-7cm damp sand, a deep layer of good loam soil sloping up, a small dish of clean water at the lower end, we added moss, bark, a dark-brown wide-necked rectangular glass bottle for him to creep inside, a small jar of water with fresh dock leaves, a shady place, somewhere to climb & perch.In a little vivarium we kept his prey, with grass & a piece of rotten wood. We weighed & measured him nearly every day. We part-filled the sink with luke warm water & popped him in to swim - breaststroke at first, sometimes with his arms straight at sides, streamlining himself,leg kicks only. After 4 weeks we released him.
